image.altText: A man standing in front of a house

props.synopsis: Investors with 10 or more properties to their name have more debt than smaller-scale investors but use negative gearing and capital gains discounts to keep buying, tax office data shows.

title.children: After years of 'hard slog', this landlord has more than 100 properties — but not everyone agrees the system is fair

image.altText: man gather in a street

props.synopsis: Lebanon's second-largest city, Tripoli, has largely been spared the Israeli air strikes smashing the country's south, Beqaa Valley and southern Beirut. But the influx of refugees has exposed ongoing tensions in the country between its Shia, Sunni and Christian communities.

title.children: In Lebanon, some towns fear Hezbollah members are among the Shia refugees pouring in

image.altText: A man stands on the front porch of a house, behind a sign that says 'Trump 2024'.

props.synopsis: Soon after Donald Trump claimed Haitian migrants were eating cats and dogs in Ohio, he turned his attention to another part of the US.

title.children: 'Not so beautiful now': How Trump's remarks on Haitian migrants inflamed tensions in smalltown America

image.altText: James Davis wearing a cap

props.synopsis: James-Robert Davis's former partner said she was tattooed, forced to wear a collar, and told to sign a contract making her a "slave", while she was subjected to his control.

title.children: Alleged sex-cult leader jailed for domestic violence offences against woman he 'enslaved'

image.altText: Recording artist Sean "Puff Daddy" Combs, ring detail, attends the grand opening weekend at Omnia Nightclub

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs will for now remain in one of America's most notorious prisons as a case is built against the music mogul. However, what happens next as more accusers come out remains anyone's guess.

title.children: Enablers, helpers, backers. Why the charges against Sean 'Diddy' Combs could have far-reaching implications

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing at night, with shades of blue and green, over green pastures

props.synopsis: A spell of wild weather is on the cards for everywhere from Queensland to Tasmania, with thunderstorms forecast to sweep across Australia's east over the next 48 hours.

title.children: Wild weather predicted across Australia's south-east over next 48 hours

image.altText: M1A1 Abrams tank

props.synopsis: The announcement was welcomed by Ukraine's ambassador to Australia, Vasyl Myroshnychenko.

title.children: Ukraine to receive aging Abrams tanks in latest Australian military aid package

image.altText: Liam Hooper sits at a cafe table on a city street.

props.synopsis: Staring at a third recession in just two years, Kiwis are moving across the ditch to Australia in substantial numbers, seeking a sunnier economic climate.

title.children: New Zealand's economic woes lure thousands of Kiwis to Australia

image.altText: The 23andMe logo seen on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: Eight years ago, in what now seems like an act of reckless naivety, I bought my brother a 23andMe at-home DNA-test birthday present. Now the struggling company may sell its treasure trove of genetic data.

title.children: Eight years ago, my brother gave his DNA to 23andMe. We can't take it back — and it may soon get sold

image.altText: Justice Gregory Geason looks off camera.

props.synopsis: Justice Gregory Geason has been on leave with pay for almost a year while he faced allegations of family violence, but the Tasmanian government appears to have no mechanism to suspend or remove him, even after his guilty verdict.

title.children: Judge guilty of causing concussion and bruising to a woman, but will remain on a $500,000 salary

image.altText: A grey and white little fluffy Greater gliders on a gum tree  branch looking ahead with big round eyes and a long fluffy tail.

props.synopsis: Logging is set to continue in areas where hundreds of endangered gliders have been sighted, despite conservationists warning the government regulator of their presence.

title.children: Surveys find three times the number of endangered gliders present than what loggers claim

image.altText: The clasped feet of a ten-month-old baby boy on a blue rug.

props.synopsis: The national birth rate has hit a record low and is now at a critical level, with economic consequences for the future.

title.children: As Australia's fertility rate hits rock bottom have we hit the point of no return?

image.altText: A ni-Vanuatu man poses with his daughter, who is wearing a bright pink dress

props.synopsis: A former striker for Vanuatu's national youth soccer team drowned in a dam while on the job in Australia. He's one of at least 84 Pacific seasonal workers who have died here since 2020.

title.children: Moken was working on a NSW farm when he drowned. His family in Vanuatu want answers

image.altText: A cloud of grey dusty smoke rises in the middle of a tightly packed city of apartments

props.synopsis: A barrage of Israeli air strikes hit towns across southern Lebanon and Beirut's southern suburbs. Meanwhile, the Israeli prime minister dismisses calls for a ceasefire.

title.children: Mayor of Lebanese town killed in Israeli strikes as Netanyahu rejects calls for ceasefire

image.altText: A local resident and a rescuer stand on debris of a building.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president tells politicians his plan contains five main points that rely on Kyiv's allies, including an unconditional invitation to join NATO and specific weapons support.

title.children: Zelenskyy unveils victory plan as Russia reports capture of two Ukrainian villages

image.altText: Dozens of people put their hands in the air at a concert.

props.synopsis: Hidden fees and practices like dynamic pricing — which sees ticket prices go up as an event becomes more popular — have outraged consumers.

title.children: Concert ticket dynamic pricing, hotel and gym hidden fees, face government ban

image.altText: What appears to be the feet of a male, following someone in high heels in a dark environment with shadows.

props.synopsis: A Personal Safety Survey, released by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, has found an estimated 2.7 million Australians have been stalked, with women more likely to be followed by a man they know.

title.children: One in five Australian women have been stalked, according to new data

image.altText: a man with a beard in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Former Labor minister Ian Macdonald has alleged a "miscarriage of justice" in an appeal against his prison sentence for corruptly awarding a mining licence in the NSW Hunter Valley.

title.children: Ex-NSW minister appeals 14-year jail term for corruptly awarding mine licence

image.altText: Dozens of army recruits in green uniforms crowd around a desk where some people are signing white forms

props.synopsis: State media claims more than a million people have signed up to North Korea's army, as tensions continue to simmer between Pyongyang and South Korea.

title.children: 'Wiped off the map': North Korea claims more than a million new recruits have signed up to its army amid tensions with South Korea

image.altText: A teenage boy's hands on a table. He is fidgeting, wrapping fingers around his thumb.

props.synopsis: The boy, who was incarcerated in Perth's Banksia Hill Detention Centre and faced 36 criminal charges, has been released from custody without further penalties. A magistrate described him as WA's "most vulnerable child".

title.children: 'State's most vulnerable child': 11yo WA boy released after a total 77 days in custody

image.altText: A seawall damaged in a storm.

props.synopsis: Roads and beaches on the tropical Cocos (Keeling) Islands in the Indian Ocean remain shut, but a rising tide and further high swells have officials worried that the worst is yet to come.

title.children: 'Absolute freak' swells topple seawalls, bury beaches on Australia's most remote territory

image.altText: a woman giving the finger at a man as he walks away

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Lee made the gesture towards a journalist at a press conference after the ACT Property Council's leaders' debate on Wednesday.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee makes rude gesture at journalist following tense press conference exchange

image.altText: Jerry Seinfeld smiling.

props.synopsis: US comedian Jerry Seinfeld walks back a claim he made earlier this year that there is a lack of quality television comedy because "people [are] worrying so much about offending other people".

title.children: US comedian Jerry Seinfeld retracts claim 'extreme left' has ruined TV comedy

image.altText: Lisa Marie Presley at the Cartier Flagship Store for a special party to unveil the book "Cartier: Untamed".

props.synopsis: Lisa Marie Presley died before she had the chance to finish her memoir, From Here To The Great Unknown. Per her wishes, her eldest daughter Riley Keough helped it make its way into the world.

title.children: Lisa Marie Presley's posthumous memoir is a sad, shocking and tender look at the price paid for fame

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump dancing at campaign event

props.synopsis: The US presidential candidate wrapped up his event ahead of schedule but remained on stage while nine songs played.

title.children: Donald Trump turns campaign event into impromptu musical session

image.altText: Five beers are held up as people cheers

props.synopsis: Prague has banned night-time pub crawls organised by travel agencies. Is this the end of the stag do?

title.children: World's thirstiest nation bans organised night-time pub crawls

image.altText: Two young men smile for the camera on the red carpet for the 2019 Logies.

props.synopsis: Radio host, TV star and podcaster Hamish Blake on his secret fitness training, taking up golf, the "barbs that stick in your heart" when raising children, and other parenting challenges.

title.children: 'A fight that's ultimately futile': Hamish Blake on facing his own mortality in his home gym

image.altText: ACT Labor Leader Andrew Barr stands on a stage speaking behind a podium.

props.synopsis: The ACT chief minister says it was a mistake to appoint Walter Sofronoff to head an inquiry into the trial of Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Barr says Sofronoff's appointment to board of inquiry a 'mistake'

image.altText: Small round balls on a beach

props.synopsis: Hundreds of mysterious black spheres that washed up on three popular beaches in Sydney have been identified as tar balls.

title.children: Mysterious black balls identified after washing up on three Sydney beaches

image.altText: a man stands in a gallery smiling at the camera with art in the background

props.synopsis: Iain Dawson has pleaded guilty to transferring $34,000 of art gallery funds into his own bank account.

title.children: Former art gallery director guilty of theft of $34,000 of Archibald ticket sales

image.altText: Gregory Geason on mobile phone outside court.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian Supreme Court judge is found guilty of one charge each of assault and emotional abuse or intimidation.

title.children: Tasmanian Supreme Court judge found guilty of assault

image.altText: Bailey Smith screams

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs and Geelong agree on a last-minute deal that sends Bailey Smith to the Cats, while Jake Stringer leaves Essendon for GWS as AFL trade period ends with a flurry of late moves.

title.children: Smith moves to Cats, Stringer joins Giants as trade deadline day springs to life in final minutes

image.altText: Jess lies on the grass laughing.

props.synopsis: Jess Cerro — aka the singer-songwriter Montaigne — didn't study music in school because the tuition was expensive, but taught themselves guitar and pursued music anyway.

title.children: For years Montaigne assumed their savings were taken care of. Then they realised 'the truth' about their finances

image.altText: A group of people holding signs and flags walk in a protest rally.

props.synopsis: Staff at the Australian National University in Canberra have been asked to forgo an agreed pay rise amid efforts to get the university's budget under control.

title.children: 'I know this is a big ask': ANU staff urged to forgo agreed pay rise to keep university afloat

image.altText: A room with ocean views.

props.synopsis: The prime minister's seaside property purchase raised eyebrows, but many politicians have larger property holdings.

title.children: As the PM's 'clifftop' home raises eyebrows, explore the property portfolios of all federal politicians
